alert.note: Alert for Howard; Little River; Sevier (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 24 at 1:17PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Arkansas, including the following counties, Howard, Little River and Sevier. Portions of southeast Oklahoma, including the following county, McCurtain. * WHEN...Through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Additional rainall amounts of one to two inches will be possible across the region through sunrise Monday Morning. Excessive, heavy rainfall fell last night and this morning with widespread rainfall amounts of three to five inches recorded. The additional rainfall tonight could result in additional flooding concerns.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
